page.title: 11Tamar Valley,Local History 2
page.content: Some{historical sites}are situated on{ derelict land. There was extensive {mining}in the area and there are many remains of old mining works. Also many adits, the location of which are not always known making walking in the area a hazard. Old lime kilns can be found, their fumes once thought to be a cure for bronchitis. On the Devon side of the Tamar there is an entrance to what was once a Roman Fort. There are also remains of old quays, a reminder of the days of the once flourishing{trade}that made the area prosperous. On the shores can be found ballast stones left behind by the trading vessels. Finally one can find one or two examples of underground store houses and a butter larder, a reminder of{ {home-life}in the days before refrigerators.
